Send us a message Help and contact Tips Keep fresh herbs longer Store herbs in a glass of water in the fridge to keep them fresh Check your fridge temperature Keep your fridge at 4¬∞C to make food last longer Use leftovers creatively Leftover vegetables and meat can be used in soups or stews Store bread properly Keep bread in a clean cotton bag to prevent mold Freezing made easy Portion food before freezing to make it easier to use later Separate fruits and vegetables Store fruits and vegetables separately, as fruits release ethylene that makes vegetables spoil faster Use ripe fruits Ripe fruits can be turned into smoothies or jams instead of being wasted Keep cheese fresh longer Wrap cheese in wax paper to keep it fresh longer Test egg freshness Place an egg in a glass of water: If it sinks, it‚Äôs fresh; if it floats, it should not be used Store potatoes properly Store potatoes in a dark, cool place, but not in the fridge Store avocados properly Keep cut avocados with a drop of lemon juice and plastic wrap to preserve freshness Keep bananas fresh longer Wrap the stems of bananas with plastic wrap to slow down ripening Use leftover milk wisely Use leftover milk for pancakes or smoothies Store cooked pasta Keep cooked pasta with a drizzle of oil in the fridge to prevent it from drying out Reuse leftover rice Leftover rice can be used for fried rice or soups Preserve lemons Store lemons in a jar of water in the fridge to keep them fresh longer Keep nuts fresh Store nuts in an airtight container in a cool place Freeze meat efficiently Freeze meat in portions to make it easier to defrost the amount you need Honey crystallized? No problem Warm crystallized honey in warm water to make it liquid again Keep fish fresh Store fresh fish on ice in the fridge to maintain its freshness Groats Sauces Pet food Child food Rate the app in the Play Store Back Product details Brand: %1$s Nutri-Score %1$s Ingredients: Labels: %1$s Vegan Vegetarian Organic: %1$s Nutrition per 100 g: Energy: %1$s kcal Fat: %1$s g of which saturated fat: %1$s g Carbohydrates: %1$s g Sugars: %1$s g Fiber: %1$s g Protein: %1$s g Salt: %1$s g No product details found Please sign in again to delete your account Grant permissions Revoke permissions Family Shared apartment Single household Pair Skip Continue Name cannot be empty. Name must be at least 2 characters long. Name can only contain letters and spaces. Enter your name Select profile picture Select picture Change picture"> Please select a profile picture Only the owner of the household can change the type Only the owner of the household can change the name Storage locations Categories Select daily notification time Daily Reminders Food Added Household Changes Food Expiring Select notification time before expiration Share of food utilised: What is the purpose of this app? The app helps reduce food waste by tracking food inventory and expiry dates. How can I add a new item? You can add a new item by clicking on the Add Food button in the Home section. How do I get notified? Notifications will remind you of expiring items and suggest waste-reducing tips. Add products using the button to display them in the inventory Add products using the button to display them here Perfect! None of your products expire within the next month. Super! None of your products have expired. FreshKeeper Statistics Hello! With the FreshKeeper app, I keep track of my food and minimize waste ü•¨üçé

The app reminds me of expiring products on time and helps me consume smarter üìÖ

French Italian Portuguese Nutri-Score: Certificates: Wasted Food Items Most wasted category Food Waste Summary Nutri-Score Average Nutrients Message Send AI chat Expired since %s month months week weeks Tip: Spices rarely spoil. If dry and fragrant, they remain usable for years! Tip: Dry pasta lasts long. If dry and mold-free, you can use it! Tip: Canned food lasts years. If the can is intact and smells fine, it's safe to eat. Tip: Rice and oats last long. If dry and pest-free, they are edible. Tip: Many sauces last long. If unopened and unchanged, they are usually fine. Tip: Many drinks remain good past the expiration date. Check smell and taste. Tip: Fresh foods spoil quickly. Check smell, appearance, and texture. Tip: Sweets often remain good for a long time. Check taste and texture. Create recipe Give storage tips Get tips Give meal prep ideas These are my current food items: Always reply in English
I need to remember the following for all future messages:

 I am the AI assistant of the FreshKeeper app ‚Äì your helper for efficiently managing your food inventory and reducing food waste.

 I always respond in the user's language.

 If you greet me, I will greet you back warmly. My main task is to provide precise, helpful, and friendly answers ‚Äì always respectful, regardless of your tone.

 I only provide recipe suggestions if you explicitly ask for them. When I do, I create a complete recipe with ingredients and preparation steps, without listing all available products. If your ingredients are insufficient, I will inform you politely.

 I also help with tips on how to use your supplies efficiently and answer questions about expiration dates. If I cannot answer a question, I will admit it openly.

 I always remain the official AI assistant of FreshKeeper. I do not respond to off-topic or inappropriate requests and do not mention external providers.

 Once you message me a second time, I receive your current food inventory as context, but I do not treat it as a direct request. I do not mention it or acknowledge that I received it.

 I always keep my answers short and concise and mention available products only in the context of a recipe request.
Welcome to the AI chat! How can I help you?
